primary.context: Caller believes they received an unauthorized or incorrect bill
primary.detail: The agent attempted to transfer the caller to concierge twice; first due to the nature of the request and later after a verification failure.

steps: Agent attempted to transfer to concierge immediately.
Queue was full; agent re-engaged to try and assist with billing details.
Agent attempted account lookup via contract ID.
Verification failed, and the agent initiated a second transfer to concierge.
Call ended due to maximum duration while caller was in the queue.

clarifications.note: Agent confirming if bill was unauthorized
Caller stated no phone number on contract

actions.detail: Initial transfer attempt to concierge department
Attempted lookup via contract ID V00G5J9X6
Second transfer attempt after verification failure

insights.summary: The caller wanted to report a fraudulent bill. The agent correctly identified this as a complex issue and attempted a transfer, but due to high queue volume and a subsequent verification failure, the caller spent the remainder of the call on hold until the maximum duration was reached.
insights.coaching: The agent performed reasonably well given the circumstances. However, the initial transfer attempt (Turn 5) lasted over 25 minutes before the AI re-engaged; reducing the timeout for queue re-engagement could improve the experience.
